page.title: 03FISHING AT NESS SIDE
page.content: Ness Side is a beautiful estate with the River Ness flowing beside it.At this part the river has several salmon pools which belong to the owner of{NESS SIDE HOUSE.} From 16th January to 15th October is the fishing season. We saw at Ness Side House a fish larder,where fishermen put the salmon on a cold slab. Each salmon's weight, the name of the fly which caught it, and the fisherman's name are all recorded in a book. If it weighs under 8 pounds it is called a grilse. An average of 300 salmon are caught in a season. We saw waders, rods and flies. Three boats are used on this stretch of river. We also saw a game larder for hanging pheasants, ducks etc. It was very cool.
